result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Alan Grady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall pay fine + costs + $15 pymt plan fee at rate of $50/month comm on 5/30/16 and 30th of each month until paid. 
Failure to Pay = 12 days DCJ w/h&t

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barry Alan Grady in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, def pleads no contest to ct. 2, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, ct. 1 is DRI, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant heard, court heard and sentence imposed. 

$200 fine plus costs to be paid at the rate of $50 a month comm 5/30, contempt sentence for FTP is 12 days in the DCJ w/huber and transfer.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Barry Alan Grady in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court leaves on JT calendar.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with LJP dob 1/6/71 or her residence.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:03 - Defendant Barry Alan Grady in court with attorney Ramneek Singh Button.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with LJP dob 1/6/1971 and her residence.  Return date scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
